title: Patient Access Representative Interview

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at SSM Health (Milwaukee, WI) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: The interview was set up over an automated text message. I emailed the HR representative to ask questions about the salary allowed for the position and if the position would be 100% remote or if it would require any travel or onsite training/work. She replied to my emails answering those questions. The interviewer was nearly 10 minutes late calling for the scheduled interview. She told me a little about the role and who I would report to and then asked if I resided in 1 of 4 states they allowed remote workers or planned to relocate. It baffles me that they ask this when it clearly states which US state you reside in when you fill out your online application and there is a question that says would you be willing to relocate which I clearly answered NO to. This is not only a waste of my time but of their time and resources. Perhaps HR should take a closer look at candidates and details (such as state of residence, minimum salary requirements, willingness to relocate, etc. prior to setting up interviews.
Interview Questions: Do you reside in 1 of 4 states and if not are you willing to relocate?

title: Pharmacy Tehcnican Interview

Relatively easy, though I attribute that more so to the specific individual I was interviewing with who made everything feel very natural.

title: Social Worker- Virtual Care Center, Bridgeton MO Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at SSM Health (Saint Louis, MO) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions:
I got the job! or so I thought.

The phone interview(7/8) with the recruiter went well and I was immediately scheduled for a virtual interview with the hiring managers. The interview (7/14) with the hiring managers went well too and I was told that I should hear from the recruiter by the following Monday. Miday Monday comes and I haven't heard anything so I email the recruiter. He responds rather quickly stating that everything went well and he'll have a offer letter to me by mid week at the latest. This morning the recruiter calls and says the hiring managers liked you but after sharing your info with the other social workers on the team they didn't think you would be a good fit. 

Thank you SSM for completely wasting my time.
Interview Questions: How do you handle difficult clients

title: Radiology Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at SSM Health (Oklahoma City, OK) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: Interview process wasn’t bad at all, very nice & friendly. However, being lied to about being a strong candidate, tough decision but they decided to go with an internal candidate, that is just wrong.  If they or any company doesn’t think I’ll be a good fit, just say that, don’t lie. Job was still posted for couple of weeks after. I did contact the person via email to see if it was possibly a different position or if that position just hadn’t been removed yet. Being told you were a strong candidate & it was a tough decision, I thought I would apply for another one. It was the same position I was told they went with an internal on and no response back from my email.  Won’t apply again for another position, I  do not  want to work for a company who lets people with those ethics, hold those positions. To me, they aren’t a good fit. .

title: Director Level Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at SSM Health
Interview Descriptions:
After four interviews with 10 different people, and almost two weeks of being ignored by the hiring manager and the talent manager, the organization sent me a form rejection email.

During the interview process, I was asked questions that both discriminated against my age (How would you feel about having direct reports that are older than you?) and my education level ("We don't think highly of people with multiple degrees here." I have a Masters degree, as per the "preferred requirements" of the job post).

They also solicited recommendations using a pushy online system that may have jeopardized my relationships with former colleagues.

This was the most disrespectful interview process I've been through in my 15+ years of interviewing.
Interview Questions: How would you feel about having direct reports that are older than you?

title: Graduate Nurse Interview

If you qualify, then you will be guided toward the next step in the process. Everything was simple and easy to understand. They asked for a video interview, which you could re-record as many times as you would like before you hit submit.  After that, they will ask you for an in-person interview with the team leader of the floor you are interested in. Once you pass that interview, you will also have a peer interview with some of the nurses working on the floor.  After those three interviews, the talent specialist will reach out to you via email and phone to confirm your job offer and employment details.

Give some examples of when you had a difficult patient experience and how you dealt with the situation. What are some qualities you would expect to see in an ideal employee?

That occurred months ago and, although I sent thank you notes, I have not heard back at all.  I am an executive and this is very unprofessional behavior for an organization that, surely, knows better.  The time, including prep time, took hours and the company should demonstrate respect for the interview candidates from whom it requests interviews.  It has been over 3 months.

I was also shown the department and met future coworkers.  Peer interviews were set by the same Recruitment Team person.  Both interviews used STAR type questions.

title: Department Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at SSM Health (Saint Louis, MO) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was very disappointed with their process. I was emailed to schedule a phone interview (phone screen) with someone from HR. The interviewer was supposed to call me at the scheduled time, and she called 20 minutes late. She was very unprepared and practically reread the job posting to me and could not answer any of my questions or provide any more details about the position. A few days later I received an email asking for FIVE references to fill out a survey. I was then asked to come for an in person interview. I was relocating to the area from 4 hours away and had to drive. When I arrived at the interview the hiring manager/ interviewer told me that I was over qualified for the job and basically didn’t even consider me. I’m not sure why someone couldn’t have told me that before I drove four hours to and from for them. Frankly, I did not ever apply with them again. Wouldn’t want to work for a company that treats candidates that way.

Interview Descriptions: I was contacted to set up a phone interview immediately after applying to the job. I set up a time and date with the Human Resources representative. They stated they were going to reach out and to ask if there was another number, but this was already after I emailed them 45 minutes after the interview was scheduled. I then was polite, and asked for another time for an interview. We then set up another date and time. When it came time for the follow up interview, no one contacted me, again, through my main phone number or my back up phone number. I emailed 13 minutes after the scheduled time, reaching out to see if there was an issue. No answer. I never did hear back. If this is how St. Mary's runs their program, I will never apply here again, nor do I know many nurses who would put up with the obvious disrespect they show potential employees.

title: Call Center Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at SSM Health (Saint Louis, MO) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online via SSM.com for this position along with several others they were offering.  I doubted that I'd hear anything due to my age, but within the next 2 weeks I did receive an offer for the position -- "that if I was still interested,  they'd like to schedule a phone interview with me." I was so excited I could hardly sit still -- to think someone would be interested in me....a grandma, still full of life and energy, who'd been struggling to survive for the past 8 years. Oh, so excited!!!...and nervous. I passed my phone interview and with the final question of, "Do you have any additional questions?" I had to respond, "When can I start??" The response of, "I'd like to offer you an in person interview, " nearly made me cry! Immediately I started compiling my degrees, awards, letters of recommendation  and touched up my resume to a current status. The Day came for my in person interview,  and i selected an appropriate outfit by which I could put my best business foot forward to the eye, and arrived for my appointment.  I spoke with another applicant in the lobby who was praying much as i, that we'd be accepted.  I was greeted by a lovely staff member and taken in for my initial interview with two very friendly ladies. Their general demeanor put me at ease and once my butterflies landed, respond to their questions of qualifications and previous work history with confidence in my abilities and my self. Thinking I'd completed the process, I was surprised by being immediately interviewed by an additional two staff members. My butterflies started once again.... but everyone was so wonderful that I met (right down to the janitorial staff) that I knew I wanted to be a part of their team. Two days later I received word that I'd been accepted and once compensations was done reviewing my background they'd be making me an employment offer. I believe that was the longest weekend I've endured in years, but that offer came through the following Tuesday, and YES I accepted immediately.  I feel truly blessed to join the team, and pray that God continues to beam through all my actions to bless my coworkers and our clients.
Interview Questions: To describe what I feel "stewardship" is.

Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at SSM Health (Saint Louis, MO) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very challenging for such a normal position. I felt like I was well prepared for it but only because I was given a lot of advice beforehand. Definitely know why you want to work specifically for SSM Health. They are very focused on their mission. I.e why do you want to work as an operations coordinator for our health system vs. wherever. What makes you specifically want to work for SSM?
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here? How do you fit with our mission?

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at SSM Health
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and it took two weeks for a phone interview. And it took a week for in person interview at ssm corporate office with two interviewers after the phone interview.
Interview Questions: Nothing was difficult but it didn't work for me.

title: Psychiatric Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at SSM Health (Bridgeton, MO) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Two Team leaders interviewed me for about 30 minutes with prewritten questions. They were slightly unprofessional. I was given a tour immediately following the interview. They called and offered me the job 30 minutes after leaving the facility.
Interview Questions: What would you do if two patients began to engage in a physical altercation.

title: Data Management Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at SSM Health (Saint Louis, MO)
Interview Descriptions: easy, recruiter did brief phone interview, 1 in person interview and called me to talk about the pay, I was able to negotiate maybe 2 thousand more, then was offered the job right away.
Interview Questions: They ask you if you can do a ton of stuff that you will never do because they want to intimidate you a bit to see if you will cave:)

title: Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at SSM Health (Saint Louis, MO) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, was then called for a phone screen, was then scheduled 2 days later for a face to face interview in which they asked behavioral based questions. I was then offered the job 3 days later. The overall experience for the interview was a very quick and easy process, I had the chance to meet the team and see what a typical day was like in the role.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you did not meet your goal and how you overcame the objective.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at SSM Health (Sunset Hills, MO) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: 3 interviews with the office manager that happened periodically through the first several weeks of being a temporary employee,  then phone, Internet forms, then employment physical and drug screen.
Interview Questions: Critique yourself

title: Computer Engineer Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at SSM Health (Madison, WI) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and I was contacted the next day to schedule an online interview. Did my phone interview where they asked about my skills pertaining to the position (very general). Was scheduled for a 2nd phone interview with the IT team. Was asked about education and experience. Was then scheduled for my face to face later that day. Went to face to face interview with a panel of 3 people (HR, CIO, Help Desk Manager). Was made an offer the very next day for the position. Was sent offer letter and instructions to conduct my background check.
Interview Questions: How soon can you start? (unexpected)

title: Systems Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at SSM Health in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: After submitting an online application, contacted by an independent recruiter working for Dean via email.  Set up a phone interview.  Interview never occurred.  Contacted recruiter via email, set up another phone interview.  Interview time came and went.  Sent email; no response.  Did some research, contacted HR.  Received apologetic email explaining recruiter no longer employed, set up phone interview.  Several days later, received email that position was filled, as they had one employee selected and decided not to hire two.  Extremely unprofessional from the start.
Interview Questions: No questions; over a month of hoops just to be denied.

title: Phlebotomist & Endoscopy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at SSM Health (Madison, WI) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions:
I had 2 interviews. One about 2 months ago for a Phlebotomist position and the other for Endoscopy Tech just a few weeks ago. The interview for the phlebotomist one didn't go so well. There were 2 people. Neither one of them looked or sounded like they wanted to be there. I never did hear anything back from them about the position. Even though they told me that they would get back to me either way. 
The interview for the Tech position was just a few weeks ago, but with how the interview went, I can honestly say I will never apply for another position with this company no matter how desperate I am. The interview was so bad that I literally emailed HR and let them know just how horrible it was and to also withdraw all my other applications from other positions I applied for. I would never want to work for a company that treats their prospective employees with such little respect and professionalism.
To make a long story short, I am a MA. From a previous employer I had gained extensive training far beyond what I had learned in college. Alot of my duties were RN work. I am very proud and honored to have those skills under my belt and if I felt I was incompetent I would never perform those duties. When asked about my previous employer and the extensive skills, one RN interviewer (there were 3) asked if I performed these skills alone. I said yes, but I always had the doctors there in case. I did recovery in PACU almost every day and IV's and had also learned to push meds thru IV's. I taught injection training, was the lab coordinator, the lead phlebotomist, the only MA at this small clinic and also a surgical tech as well. It was part of my job and I was proud to have honed those skills. I didn't just learn them overnight. Anyways, the 3 RN's who interviewed me for this position had rolled their eyes more than 3 separate times during the interview and also ridiculed me and doubted my skills. They laughed several times and mumbled under their breath about the " lack of care" at this small fertility clinic I had previously worked for. They were all literally appalled that I, a Medical Assistant, was capable of performing those skills. They made sure to  stress the fact that a MA in their clinic would never be given the chance to perform those skills no matter my level of education and certification. The amount of nonprofessional demeanor and lack of praise was sickening. From other interviews Ive had in the past few months with other clinics, the interviewers were actually delighted and happy for me that I had the proper training and opportunity to hone those skills. Never in all my entire MA existence have I ever had an interview where I was treated like a low life at the bottom of a totem pole. I have never been laughed at or doubted like that before. It took every ounce of strength I had to finish the interview and thank them for their time. The moment I hit my car, I broke down in tears. 
For anyone considering a career with this healthcare system, I would think twice. Also i found out that there really isn't much room for advancement or incentives. The benefits are horrible and the starting pay is far less than what most people expect, especially having 5 or more years of  expertise. And if an interview can go that bad, just imagine what it would be like working there??!! No thank you. 
The interview dragged on for over an hour with alot of the questions being asked several times, just in different wording. The questions were not easy and at the end of the interview  when one of them asked if I had any questions, before I could even get out 2 words, they all stood up and said ok, we will get back to shortly. They didn't even give me a chance to ask any questions. 
Some other words of advice, we are all one. Doctors, nurses, MA's, CNA's, lab personnel all need to work together as a team for their patients. The hospitals and clinic's you want to work for are the ones that don't take your title for granted or discriminate you for your title. Like I said, we are here to serve our patients and give them the best care possible. Titles are simply titles. They don't make you any better than the other. As the saying goes, never judge a book by its cover.
Interview Questions: Name a time when you had to deal with a difficult coworker and how did you figure out a solution?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at SSM Health (Bridgeton, MO) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied for position through online career portal.  Received notification from recruiter to schedule phone interview.  Interview inquired about prior work history, reason on wanting to work for SSM Health, and "Tell me about a time" type of inquiries.  After conversation with recruiter, received notification of interview with hiring manager.  This took place several days later.  Hiring manager was great.  Interview went well and then was required to job shadow and meet with the nursing staff.   Was provided a job offer several days after that. Overall, positive experience.
Interview Questions: Would you prefer to work days or nights?

title: Front End Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at SSM Health in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed here in June of 2014. I first had a phone interview, followed by 2 in-person interviews, 1 with a department head, another with a couple of peers. All of the interviews were pretty conversational, and not test oriented, though there were some question/short-answer periods. Everyone was nice, and non-intimidating. In-office interviews were scheduled back to back.
Interview Questions: What would you do if someone on your team knew more about a subject than you?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at SSM Health
Interview Descriptions: There was a quick phone interview, than an in-person interview. I applied and started within two months. The employees and management were welcoming and helpful the entire process.
Interview Questions: Nothing was too difficult, it is an entry-level position

title: Operations Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at SSM Health (Saint Louis, MO) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with department and HR.  The intervew was rather long and looking back did not give a good indication of what it would be like to work there.  I started with HR and had to interview with small groups of people.  Unfortunately this place of work is not working out.
Interview Questions: What would your perfect job look like?

title: Team Member Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at SSM Health (Jefferson City, MO) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: There was an initial phone screen with a recruiter, then an interview was scheduled with the hiring leader and then members of the team from the department, on-site.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time when you demonstrated compassion for someone else.

title: Staffing Resource Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at SSM Health (Saint Louis, MO) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: There was a peer interview process on the second round. The team was very open in their questions. The questions did pertain how you handle stress and working in close proximity with other co workers.
Interview Questions: how I handle being disrespected by clinicians

title: Billing Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at SSM Health
Interview Descriptions: You will have a pre-interview with the office supervisor who is at this time a really nice person. If she likes you then you get a second interview which is a "pier interview" where 3 of the office workers will ask you a series or "behavior based" questions. Don't worry so much about what you're answer is. It's more about what you're answer says about the kind of person you are. They are looking for someone who will fit in well with the group.
Interview Questions: There is a question about having more work than you can handle. The best answer involves prioritizing. The other difficult answer is about promoting teamwork. They are looking for someone who is willing to help others even if it's not in the scope of their normal job duties.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at SSM Health (Saint Louis, MO) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process is fairly easy. After applying online, a recruiter would contact you to conduct a telephone interview. If accepted, an in-person interview will follow. If accepted, the normal process of a background/drug test is conducted. If applying for a medical position, then a license check is also conducted. During the interview, I was completely informed about the position, company, and requirements for the job.
Interview Questions: Experience, education, expectations, and culture of the organization.

title: Certified Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at SSM Health (Mount Vernon, IL) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: One on one interview with the pharmacy director. The entire interview took about thirty minutes and the job requirements were specifically discussed, from lifting to licensure requirements. I was asked personality based questions. Most of them focused on functioning in a fast paced environment.
Interview Questions: They asked if I was eligible to sit for the certification exam.

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at SSM Health (Saint Louis, MO)
Interview Descriptions: Outsourced to a recruiting firm that was unfamiliar with hospital operations.  Did indepth phone interview and was I asked "how to spell" terms and "what is that exactly?"  It took nearly three weeks to get the phone call that I was told that I would receive the next day.  The interview with the department head was great, the peer interview was exhausting (in a good way) and was hired.
Interview Questions: What does employee engagement mean to you?

title: Lpn Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at SSM Health (Oklahoma City, OK) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, received a call for an interview.  I showed up to the interview, met the Nurse Manager and was hired on spot.  I also had to take a skills review test.
Interview Questions: What is my schedule like currently?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at SSM Health in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: Emailed wishing to set up phone interview, after phone interview i was contacted within a week to set up an in person interview. I was offered the position 2 days later via phone
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you faced a challenge that turned out to be a good experience

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at SSM Health (Kirkwood, MO)
Interview Descriptions: Interview w/ dept Director ( who was a Sister of St. Joseph ), good feedback, positive experience
Interview Questions: long range ( 5 years ) plans / expectations

title: Corp Account Follow Up Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at SSM Health (Saint Louis, MO) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: You must know someone if you are an external applicant. So after your friend or family member gets the hiring manager to pull your file. They will contact HR and a talent rep will call you and do a phone screen interview. If you aren't a complete idiot you will get an interview with the department manager and lead. If you make it through this round the next week or so you will be brought in for peer interviews. If you do not fit the culture of the group you will not be offered. If you do the manger tells HR to call you with an offer don't bother to negotiate they will not budge. After you accept the offer they will email you orientation information.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you.

title: Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at SSM Health (Denville, NJ) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was hired initially as a Traveling Nurse and then hired full-time four months later.  The whole hiring process was handled efficiently and took a matter of days to complete.  The staff in the Human Resources Department was very helpful and courteous as well as the staff in the Employee Health Department.  On the whole, the entire hiring and interview process was accomplished without any difficulty or complication and I would recommend this hospital to any would be patient or employee.
Interview Questions: Describe a difficult patient/family situation/conflict and how you handled it.

title: Patient Access Senior Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at SSM Health (Fenton, MO) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: Most interviews at SSM Health start with a phone interview and if you are moved forward will result in an interview with the hiring manager.  It is very difficult to get noticed and offered an interview with SSM Health.  It helped I had a family member already working for SSM Health.
Interview Questions: Can you describe a situation you found challenging.

title: Content Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at SSM Health (Saint Louis, MO) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: Panel of people. Very un-intimidating. At first it was one or two people on a conference call. Then is was an in-person panel interview. They were very nice and seemed to really care about what kind of person you would be in addition to their team.
Interview Questions: Mostly asked personality questions. What would you do if a client did X?

title: Sharepoint Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at SSM Health (Saint Louis, MO) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online and received a call from recruiter. 

A panel of people interviewed me. Most of the questions were based on sharepoint (workflows, customizations etc.), some questions on SQL (couple of queries). They asked me about my previous experience (walked though my resume in detail)
Interview Questions: What experience you have with sharepoint?

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at SSM Health (Saint Louis, MO) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: Decent
Interview Questions: Looking at the job description, rank each item as capable of performing task or need experience with task.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at SSM Health in Apr 2009
Interview Descriptions: Apply, phone interview, in person interview, then they will offer your the job. Its not bad very typical. It would probably be good to study common interview questions they love to ask those.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you had a disagreement with your boss and how did you handle it.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at SSM Health (Oklahoma City, OK) in Nov 2008
Interview Descriptions: After moving to OKC, attended a "job fair" at the facility and was able to talk to unit manager.
Interview Questions: My salary expectation -- I was told that there was "no way" that I would get what I'd been paid at previous job in Houston, TX
